pull.title: doc: Correct comments re. units of constants
pull.body:
In https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15848, darosior fixed up a comment which mis-identified the units of a constant.

Another comment misidentified a value as in MiB rather than MB.

verification.payload:
tree 5cf7193e1bc3481274f202a805532cc41b208b0d
parent 64f81a38b9f0e09e353d058aa88eb681a181df37
author Ben Woosley <ben.woosley@gmail.com> 1654634943 -0500
committer Ben Woosley <ben.woosley@gmail.com> 1654634947 -0500

doc: Correct comment describing value of MAX_FILE_SIZE_PSBT as in MiB

100 MiB is 100 * (10224 ** 2), or 107,374,182,400 bytes.

events.message:
doc: Correct comment describing value of MAX_FILE_SIZE_PSBT as in MiB

100 MiB is 100 * (10224 ** 2), or 107,374,182,400 bytes.

comments.body: I've checked and indeed, this value is in bytes. The `-prune` option is in MiB, but it's multiplied with 1024*1024 before being stored here.

These kind of comments are really asking to go out of sync, would be fine with removing it as well.
Would using  C++14 digit separators be an idea maybe? `100'000'000`?

My preference would be to use constants like [this one](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25386) to make the code equivalent to this documentation:
`const std::streamsize MAX_FILE_SIZE_PSBT =  100 * MB_BYTES;` though I suppose you could possibly type MIB vs MB there too.
